meta.description: New .zip domains trick people into downloading malicious files

hero.title: Watch Out!
hero.opener: New .zip domains trick people into downloading malicious files

first.title: Look out for @ signs
first.description: Check if there is an @ sign in front of the .zip portion of the link.

second.title: Hover over Links
second.description: Browsers display where a link leads in the lower left corner.

third.title: E-Mails require additional care
third.description: E-Mails enable attackers to use a wide array of styling options. Attackers can change the font size of the @ sign and make it incredibly small. This results in an invisible @.

fourth.title: Know your slashes
fourth.description: To craft a bad link, scammers need to use unicode characters U+2044 ⁄ and U+2215 ∕ in the link. They look slightly different to the correct slash /.

test.title: Test a link
test.description: Feel free to check a link by entering it below

about.title: Made with ❤️ an einem gemütlichen Wochenende
about.firstParagraph: Share this page. Tell your parents and friends. Bad files on your PC are bad times.
about.secondParagraph: This page doesn’t track you. There are no ads. The source code is
